Journal Story: Hiked the approach trail with my Atlanta buddies.

Rainy morning, forgot to put actual shorts on under my rain pants so I hiked in those all day. Also wore my REI trail gaiters on the wrong feet...note to self: reinforced side goes on the inside of the legs
First experience with trail magic! Thanks Sticks!
Woke up to find my credit card number was stolen and went on a shopping spree. Resupplied at Neels Gap... Why does my guide book call it Neel Gap?
The best beer for hiking is free and cold. Wooooo!
More trail magic today! Burgers and cokes (I grew up in the South, every soda is a coke.) I'm getting spoiled by the kindness of others.
Dutch ovened the hell out of myself last night. Must have been the cold burgers from trail magic.
Town day! Stayed in a hotel in Hiawasee. AYCE buffet and resupplied.
Made it in to North Carolina. Started snowing.
Super cold morning. Kids maintaining a fire outside the shelter this afternoon.
Stubbed my toes a lot today. Couldn't camp at Betty Creek Gap near the AT so went down the side trail and found a spot near a creek...Betty Creek perhaps?
Took public transit in to Franklin, irat year they're running a route out there and it's fantastic.
Started raining about a mile from the shelter. Put on my rain jacket and pack cover but no pants. It's all fun and games until your inner thighs get wet, then you start to worry about chafing...
Enjoyed the fleece liner I picked up in Franklin. It's keeping me quite warm now.
First time at NOC. Shared a four person room. The Sherpa Chicken is good...so is the beer.
Stayed in a tiny house at a place called Cabin in the Woods. Saw it in AWOL's guide.
Cluster of shuttling around Fontana Resort and the shelter. Finally able to print Smokies permit...their online system had been down for over a week.
First day in the Smokies! Had a butt-clenching climb up Shuckstack Fire Tower
Gooood ole Rocky Top. Rocky Top Tennessee...
Passed the highest point of the AT...it's all downhill from here, right?
I quit, I can't take any more cold weather.April fools. Got a ride from NOC in to Gatlinburg.
Great day for trail magic. Thanks Mountain Momma and Godspeed for being at Newfound Gap. Thanks Chuck and Tadd for bringing McDonald's to the shelter.
Nice ridge walking day
Last night in the Smokies! Tomorrow, I can see the inside of my tent again!
Standing Bear Farms was a nice place to hang out for a while and resupply.
Super windy! Tried to camp on the ridge near the shelter but the wind forced us to go down the hill to the real campsite. Way to not read the guide, Shoe.
Hot Springs!
Zero day! Hitchhiked to Asheville to meet up with my brother.
Double zero! Bought new pack, socks, and tent stakes at REI, and then drank a lot of beer and ate a lot of good food.
Hard to escape the town vortex after a double zero.
Howard and his rock...
Rainy morning :-(
Met the Real Hiking Viking!
Town vortex sucking me in...
No good spots to tent around there.
Stopped just south of Iron Mountain
Enjoyed the quick stop at Greasy Creek Friendly
Overmountain Shelter is pretty cool but I wanted to hike more miles today.
Happy birthday to me. Enjoyed a pizza at the hostel.
Detoured and then stopped by the wild fire. The owners of Black Bear Resort stayed open late and shuttled hikers in. Awesome.
Warm day. Firehawk helicopter doing laps to help fight the fire I ran through yesterday. Sped through bear area with the help of some trail magic.
Can you feel it? Damascus is pulling. Make big miles today. Ignore the rain.
Apparently Dave's Place does not have mattresses...at least the shower is hot.
Zero! Sent home about 4 lbs of stuff and replaced pump filter with Sawyer.
Hit the wall hard. Went to bed with a fever and I feel like shit.
Still feeling feverish and weak. Sore throat. Trail magic!
Late entry in to camp, everyone else ordered their pizzas already. Got pizza anyway. Love my hiker family.
Not many (zero) good spots to camp here...but there's a privy.
Great views and cool meadows.
Trail magic! And they gave me a ride in to Bland so I could get my resupply box.
Still managing to hide from the really bad overnight weather. More trail magic!
Woods Hole Hostel is pretty awesome. Definitely worth the 0.5 mile hike from the trail. Delicious salad and chili for dinner.
Ate myself sick at the Chinese buffet in Pearisburg. Sending home my cold weather gear!
Mailed back my winter gear! About 7 lbs of stuff.
What's got two thumbs and regrets mailing home his winter gear? This guy. Got snowed on today :-(
Passed Keffer Oak as well as the Eastern Continental Divide
Ate myself into a food coma at The Homeplace
McAfee Knob and Tinker Cliffs and Hay Rock
Zero day!
First time to be alone at a shelter...
Got a headlamp from a nice section hiker when I mentioned I left mine in Daleville
Early bedtime...7:30 early for me at least
Awesome hostel, Oma and Marsha are fantastic. Shuttled in from US 60
Cold and windy. Tented for warmth. Lots of weekend hikers today.
Hitched down to Devils Backbone and got some delicious food and beers
Ate too much at the Chinese buffet again!
